page.title: 02FARMING AROUND BUCHLYVIE 1
page.content: Farming is the main industry in the area, all the farms being worked by their owners. The land in the north is low lying and suited to{dairy and {arable}farming while to the south is the rising slope of moorland with { {beef and lamb}production the main occupation.{DAIRY FARMS}in the area are{WOODEND, 340 ACRES,}110 Friesian cows and crops of silage, barley and oats; {CASHLEY,280 ACRES,}70 Friesian cows and crops of silage and barley; { {WESTER MYE,180 ACRES,}70 Friesian cows and crops of barley, hay and turnips;{ {GARTENTRUACH,190 ACRES,}85 cows and crops of hay and barley;{CAUSEWAYHEAD {220 ACRES,}40 Friesian cows, 50 store cattle and crops of hay and barley. The exceptionally wet summer and autumn of 1985 has made it difficult for farmers in the area to harvest their crops as usual.
